greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Symmetric triangle of certain normalized products of decreasing factorials.
comment: Similar to, but different from, superfactorial Pascal triangle A009963.
formula: a(n, m)=0 if n< m-1; a(n, m)=1 if m=0 or n=-1; a(n, m)= product((n-p)!, p=0..m-1)/superfac(m-1) if n>=0, 1<=m<=n+1, where superfac(n) := A000178(n), n>=0, (superfactorials).
Equals ConvOffsStoT transform of the factorials, A000142: (1, 1, 2, 6, 24,...); e.g., ConvOffs transform of (1, 1, 2, 6) = (1, 6, 12, 6, 1). - _Gary W. Adamson_, Apr 21 2008
xref: Column sequences give: A000012 (powers of 1), A000142 (factorials), A010790, A090443-4, etc.
Cf. A090445 (row sums), A090446 (alternating row sums).
results.author: _Wolfdieter Lang_, Dec 23 2003
